DD.Drag.name: DD.Drag

node.description: Y.Node instance to use as the element to initiate a drag operation

activeHandle.description: This config option is set by Drag to inform you of which handle fired the drag event (in the case that there are several handles): default false.

dragNode.description: Y.Node instance to use as the draggable element, defaults to node

move.description: If this is false, the drag element will not move with the cursor: default true. Can be used to "resize" the element.

target.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module has been loaded. It will make this node a drop target as well as draggable.

startCentered.description: Center the dragNode to the mouse position on drag:start: default false

offsetNode.description: Offset the drag element by the difference in cursor position: default true

handles.description: Array of valid handles to add. Adding something here will set all handles, even if previously added with addHandle

haltDown.description: Should the mousedown event be halted. Default: true

clickPixelThresh.description: The number of pixels to move to start a drag operation, default is 3.

bubbles.description: Controls the default bubble parent for this Drag instance. Default: Y.DD.DDM. Set to false to disable bubbling. Use bubbleTargets in config

groups.description: Array of groups to add this drag into.

lock.description: Set to lock this drag element so that it can't be dragged: default false.

dragMode.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module is active. It will set the dragMode (point, intersect, strict) of this Drag instance.

useShim.description: Use the protective shim on all drag operations: default true. Only works with dd-ddm, not dd-ddm-base.

dragging.description: This attribute is not meant to be used by the implementor, it is meant to be used as an Event tracker so you can listen for it to change.

data.description: A payload holder to store arbitrary data about this drag object, can be used to store any value.

primaryButtonOnly.description: By default a drag operation will only begin if the mousedown occurred with the primary mouse button. Setting this to false will allow for all mousedown events to trigger a drag.

clickTimeThresh.description: The number of milliseconds a mousedown has to pass to start a drag operation, default is 1000.

constructors.description: Provides the ability to drag a Node.

START_EVENT.description: This property defaults to "mousedown", but when drag-gestures is loaded, it is changed to "gesturemovestart"

_fromTimeout.description: Flag to determine if the drag operation came from a timeout

_handles.description: A private hash of the valid drag handles

_ieSelectBack.description: We will hold a copy of the current "onselectstart" method on this property, and reset it after we are done using it.

_invalidsDefault.description: A private hash of the default invalid selector strings: {'textarea': true, 'input': true, 'a': true, 'button': true, 'select': true}

lastXY.description: The position of the element as it's moving (for offset calculations)

_groups.description: Storage Array for the groups this drag belongs to.

_ev_md.description: A private reference to the mousedown DOM event

_bubbleTargets.description: The default bubbleTarget for this object. Default: Y.DD.DDM

_startTime.description: The getTime of the mousedown event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

_endTime.description: The getTime of the mouseup event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

_dragThreshMet.description: Private flag to see if the drag threshhold was met

actXY.description: The xy that the node will be set to. Changing this will alter the position as it's dragged.

realXY.description: The real xy position of the node.

deltaXY.description: The offset of the mouse position to the element's position

_invalids.description: A private hash of the invalid selector strings

target.description: This will be a reference to the Drop instance associated with this drag if the target: true config attribute is set..

mouseXY.description: The XY coords of the mousemove

region.description: A region object associated with this drag, used for checking regions while dragging.

addToGroup.description: Add this Drag instance to a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group additions.
addToGroup.param: {String} g The group to add this Drag Instance to.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to add this Drag Instance to.

_setStartPosition.description: Sets the current position of the Element and calculates the offset
_setStartPosition.param: {Array} xy The XY coords to set the position to.

params.name: xy
params.description: The XY coords to set the position to.

_fixDragStart.description: The function we use as the ondragstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer. This keeps IE from blowing up on images as drag handles.

_defDragFn.description: Default function for drag:drag. Fired from _moveNode.

params.name: ev
params.description: The drag:drag event

stopDrag.description: Method will forcefully stop a drag operation. For example calling this from inside an ESC keypress handler will stop this drag.

params.name: ev
params.description: The mousemove DOM event

validClick.description: Method first checks to see if we have handles, if so it validates the click against the handle. Then if it finds a valid handle, it checks it against the invalid handles list. Returns true if a good handle was used, false otherwise.

removeInvalid.description: Remove an invalid handle added by addInvalid
removeInvalid.param: {String} str The invalid handle to remove from the internal list.

params.name: str
params.description: The invalid handle to remove from the internal list.

addHandle.description: Add a handle to a drag element. Drag only initiates when a mousedown happens on this element.
addHandle.param: {String} str The selector to test for a valid handle. Must be a child of the element.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector to test for a valid handle. Must be a child of the element.

initializer.description: Internal init handler

removeHandle.description: Remove a Selector added by addHandle
removeHandle.param: {String} str The selector for the handle to be removed.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector for the handle to be removed.

_handleMouseDownEvent.description: Handler for the mousedown DOM event

_moveNode.description: This method performs the actual element move.

destructor.description: Lifecycle destructor, unreg the drag from the DDM and remove listeners

_ieSelectFix.description: The function we use as the onselectstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer

_defAlignFn.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.

params.name: e
params.description: The drag:align event.

_createEvents.description: This method creates all the events for this Event Target and publishes them so we get Event Bubbling.

_timeoutCheck.description: The method passed to setTimeout to determine if the clickTimeThreshold was met.

removeFromGroup.description: Remove this Drag instance from a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group removals.
removeFromGroup.param: {String} g The group to remove this Drag Instance from.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to remove this Drag Instance from.

_fixIEMouseUp.description: This method copies the _ieSelectFix property back to the onselectstart listner on the document.

_defEndFn.description: Handler for fixing the selection in IE

_alignNode.description: This method performs the alignment before the element move.
_alignNode.param: {Array} eXY The XY to move the element to, usually comes from the mousemove DOM event.

params.name: eXY
params.description: The XY to move the element to, usually comes from the mousemove DOM event.

return.description: True or false if the Object contains the methods needed to Drag

_canDrag.description:
Checks the object for the methods needed to drag the object around. 
Normally this would be a node instance, but in the case of Graphics, it
may be an SVG node or something similar.

params.name: n
params.description: The object to check

_prevEndFn.description: Handler for preventing the drag:end event. It will reset the node back to it's start position

_prep.description: Attach event listners and add classname

addInvalid.description: Add a selector string to test the handle against. If the test passes the drag operation will not continue.
addInvalid.param: {String} str The selector to test against to determine if this is an invalid drag handle.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector to test against to determine if this is an invalid drag handle.

_defMouseDownFn.description: Handler for the mousedown DOM event

_handleMouseUp.description: Handler for the mouseup DOM event

_align.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.
_align.param: {Array} xy The xy coords to align with.

params.name: xy
params.description: The xy coords to align with.

_handleTarget.description: Attribute handler for the target config attribute.

_unprep.description: Detach event listeners and remove classname

_fixIEMouseDown.description: This method copies the onselectstart listner on the document to the _ieSelectFix property

apply.description: Applies a schema to an array of data located in a JSON structure, returning a normalized object with results in the `results` property. Additional information can be parsed out of the JSON for inclusion in the `meta` property of the response object. If an error is encountered during processing, an `error` property will be added. The input _data_ is expected to be an object or array. If it is a string, it will be passed through `Y.JSON.parse()`. If _data_ contains an array of data records to normalize, specify the _schema.resultListLocator_ as a dot separated path string just as you would reference it in JavaScript. So if your _data_ object has a record array at _data.response.results_, use _schema.resultListLocator_ = "response.results". Bracket notation can also be used for array indices or object properties (e.g. "response['results']"); This is called a "path locator" Field data in the result list is extracted with field identifiers in _schema.resultFields_. Field identifiers are objects with the following properties: `key` : (required) The path locator (String) `parser`: A function or the name of a function on `Y.Parsers` used to convert the input value into a normalized type. Parser functions are passed the value as input and are expected to return a value. If no value parsing is needed, you can use path locators (strings) instead of field identifiers (objects) -- see example below. If no processing of the result list array is needed, _schema.resultFields_ can be omitted; the `response.results` will point directly to the array. If the result list contains arrays, `response.results` will contain an array of objects with key:value pairs assuming the fields in _schema.resultFields_ are ordered in accordance with the data array values. If the result list contains objects, the identified _schema.resultFields_ will be used to extract a value from those objects for the output result. To extract additional information from the JSON, include an array of path locators in _schema.metaFields_. The collected values will be stored in `response.meta`.

{Object} [schema] Schema to apply.  Supported configuration
properties are:

params.name: [schema.resultFields]
params.description:
Field identifiers to
locate/assign values in the response records. See above for
details.

params.name: [schema.metaFields]
params.description:
Path locators to extract extra
non-record related information from the data object.

params.description: JSON data or its string serialization.

ProgressBar.name: ProgressBar

ratio.description: Calculate the ratio based on max and min values.

orientation.description:
Display orientation of the progressbar (i.e. vertical or
horizontal).

min.description:
Represents the lowest value for the bar. The bar will be
totally collapsed when reaching this value. Values lower than
this will be ignored.

max.description:
Represents the top value for the bar. The bar will be fully
extended when reaching this value. Values higher than this will
be ignored.

value.description:
The value for the bar. Valid values are in between the minValue
and maxValue attributes.

label.description: Display label of the progressbar. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-progressbar-text and get its innerHTML to be used as label.

statusNode.description: DOM Node to display the satus bar of the progressbar. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-progressbar-status.

step.description: Calculate the progressbar step based on ratio value.

height.description: Display height of the progressbar.

textNode.description: DOM Node to display the text of the progressbar. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-progressbar-text.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Progressbar, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • A visual means of showing progress of an ongoing operation
  • Can be enhanced via CSS styles to provide different colors, shapes and textures
  • The bar can move horizontally or vertically
  • The movement can be enhanced by using the Animation utility
Quick Example:
var progress = new A.ProgressBar({
boundingBox: '#boudingBox',
orientation: 'horizontal',
width: 300
})
.render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for ProgressBar.

Dialog.name: Dialog

draggable.description: Boolean specifying if the Panel should be draggable.

dragInstance.description: Stores the Drag instance for the A.DD.Drag used by this Dialog.

resizable.description: Boolean specifying if the Panel should be resizable.

stack.description: If true give stacking habilities to the Dialog.

strings.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Dialog's UI.

destroyOnClose.description: Invoke the destroy method when the dialog is closed (i.e., remove the Dialog boundingBox from the body, purge events etc).

resizableInstance.description: Stores the Resize instance for the A.Resize used by this Dialog.

buttons.description:
Array of object literals, each containing a set of properties defining a button to be appended into the Dialog's footer. Each button object in the buttons array can have two properties:

text:
The text that will display on the face of the button. The text can include HTML, as long as it is compliant with HTML Button specifications.
handler:
A reference to a function that should fire when the button is clicked. (In this case scope of this function is always its Dialog instance.)

modal.description: True if the Panel should be displayed in a modal fashion, automatically creating a transparent mask over the document that will not be removed until the Dialog is dismissed. Uses OverlayMask.

close.description: If true the close icon will be displayed on the Dialog header.

constrain2view.description:
Will attempt to constrain the dialog to the boundaries of the
viewport region.

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Dialog, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Emulate the behavior of an dialog window using a floating, draggable HTML element
  • Interface for easily gathering information from the user without leaving the underlying page context
  • Using the IOPlugin, supports the submission of form data either through an XMLHttpRequest, through a normal form submission, or through a fully script-based response
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Dialog({
bodyContent: 'Dialog body',
centered: true,
constrain2view: true,
destroyOnClose: true,
draggable: true,
height: 250,
resizable: false,
stack: true,
title: 'Dialog title',
width: 500
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Dialog.

Dialog.NAME.description: Static property provides a string to identify the class.

Dialog.ATTRS.description:
Static property used to define the default attribute
configuration for the Dialog.

Dialog.description:
A base class for Dialog, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Emulate the behavior of an dialog window using a floating, draggable HTML element
  • Interface for easily gathering information from the user without leaving the underlying page context
  • Using the IOPlugin, supports the submission of form data either through an XMLHttpRequest, through a normal form submission, or through a fully script-based response
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Dialog({
bodyContent: 'Dialog body',
centered: true,
constrain2view: true,
destroyOnClose: true,
draggable: true,
height: 250,
resizable: false,
stack: true,
title: 'Dialog title',
width: 500
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Dialog.

_REPLACER.description: Regex replacer function or string for normal matches.

_START_REGEX.description:
Regular expression template for highlighting start-of-string matches (i.e., only matches that occur at the beginning of a string). The placeholder %needles will be replaced with a list of needles to match, joined by | characters.

See _REGEX for a description of the capturing subpatterns this regex should contain.

_TEMPLATE.description: Highlight template which will be used as a replacement for matched substrings. The placeholder {s} will be replaced with the matched substring.

_REGEX.description:
Regular expression template for highlighting a match that occurs anywhere in a string. The placeholder %needles will be replaced with a list of needles to match, joined by | characters.

This regex should have two capturing subpatterns: the first should match an unclosed HTML entity (e.g. "&" without a ";" at the end) 0 or 1 times; the second should contain the %needles placeholder. The first subpattern match is used to emulate a negative lookbehind assertion, in order to prevent highlighting inside HTML entities.

Highlight.description:
Provides methods for highlighting strings within other strings by wrapping them in HTML.

The highlight methods first escape any special HTML characters in the input strings and then highlight the appropriate substrings by wrapping them in a <b class="yui3-highlight"></b> element. The <b> element is used rather than <strong> in accordance with HTML5's definition of <b> as being purely presentational, which is exactly what highlighting is.

Plugin.Host.name: Plugin.Host
Plugin.Host.description:
An augmentable class, which provides the augmented class with the ability to host plugins. It adds plug and unplug methods to the augmented class, which can be used to add or remove plugins from instances of the class.

Plugins can also be added through the constructor configuration object passed to the host class' constructor using the "plugins" property. Supported values for the "plugins" property are those defined by the plug method. For example the following code would add the AnimPlugin and IOPlugin to Overlay (the plugin host):

var o = new Overlay({plugins: [ AnimPlugin, {fn:IOPlugin, cfg:{section:"header"}}]});

Plug.Host's protected _initPlugins and _destroyPlugins methods should be invoked by the host class at the appropriate point in the host's lifecyle.

PluginHost.description: Adds pluginhost constructor configuration and static configuration support

plug.return: {Base} A reference to the host object
plug.description:
Registers plugins to be instantiated at the class level (plugins 
which should be plugged into every instance of the class by default).
plug.param: {Function} hostClass The host class on which to register the plugins

params.name: hostClass
params.description: The host class on which to register the plugins

params.name: plugin
params.description: Either the plugin class, an array of plugin classes or an array of objects (with fn and cfg properties defined)

params.name: config
params.description: (Optional) If plugin is the plugin class, the configuration for the plugin

return.description: returns true, if the plugin has been plugged into this host, false otherwise.

hasPlugin.description: Determines if a plugin has plugged into this host.

params.name: ns
params.description: The plugin's namespace

_destroyPlugins.description: Unplugs and destroys all plugins on the host

unplug.return: {Base} A reference to the host object
unplug.description:
Unregisters any class level plugins which have been registered by the host class, or any
other class in the hierarchy.
unplug.param: {Function} hostClass The host class from which to unregister the plugins

params.name: hostClass
params.description: The host class from which to unregister the plugins

params.name: plugin
params.description: The plugin class, or an array of plugin classes

_initConfigPlugins.description:
A protected initialization method, used by the host class to initialize
plugin configurations passed the constructor, through the config object.
Host objects should invoke this method at the appropriate time in their
construction lifecycle.
_initConfigPlugins.param: {Object} config The configuration object passed to the constructor

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object passed to the constructor

_initPlugins.description:
Initializes static plugins registered on the host (using the
Base.plug static method) and any plugins passed to the 
instance through the "plugins" configuration property.
_initPlugins.param: {Config} config The configuration object with property name/value pairs.

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object with property name/value pairs.

StackedComboSplineSeries.name: StackedComboSplineSeries

constructors.description:
The StackedComboSplineSeries class renders a combination of splines, plots and areaspline fills in a single series. Series
are stacked along the value axis to indicate each series contribution to a cumulative total. Each
series type has a corresponding boolean attribute indicating if it is rendered. By default, all three types are
rendered.

_setStyles.param: {Object} newStyles Hash of properties to update.

params.name: newStyles
params.description: Hash of properties to update.

_getDefaultStyles.description:
Gets the default value for the `styles` attribute. Overrides
base implementation.

styles.description:
Style properties used for drawing area fills. This attribute is inherited from `Renderer`. Below are the default values:
<dl>
<dt>color</dt><dd>The color of the fill. The default value is determined by the order of the series on the graph. The color will be 
retrieved from the following array:
`["#66007f", "#a86f41", "#295454", "#996ab2", "#e8cdb7", "#90bdbd","#000000","#c3b8ca", "#968373", "#678585"]`
</dd>
<dt>alpha</dt><dd>Number between 0 and 1 that indicates the opacity of the fill. The default value is 1</dd>
</dl>

type.description: Read-only attribute indicating the type of series.

The AreaSeries class renders quantitative data on a graph by creating a fill between 0
and the relevant data points.

Intl.name: Intl

return.description: boolean true if successful, false if not.

setLang.description: Sets the active language for the given module. Returns false on failure, which would happen if the language had not been registered through the add() method.

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

params.name: lang
params.description: The BCP 47 language tag.

return.description: String | Object A copy of the module's localized resources, or a single value if key is provided.

get.description:
Gets the module's localized resources for the currently active language (as provided by the getLang method).

Optionally, the localized resources for alternate languages which have been added to Intl (see the add method) can be retrieved by providing the BCP 47 language tag as the lang parameter.

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

params.name: key
params.description: Optional. A single resource key. If not provided, returns a copy (shallow clone) of all resources.

params.name: lang
params.description: Optional. The BCP 47 language tag. If not provided, the module's currently active language is used.

getLang.description: Get the currently active language for the given module.

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

getAvailableLangs.description:
Gets the list of languages for which localized resources are available for a given module, based on the module
meta-data (part of loader). If loader is not on the page, returns an empty array.
getAvailableLangs.param: {String} module The name of the module

params.name: module
params.description: The name of the module

params.name: module
params.description: The module name.

params.name: lang
params.description: The BCP 47 language tag.

params.name: strings
params.description: The hash of localized values, keyed by the string name.

add.description: Register a hash of localized resources for the given module and language

return.description:
The available language that best matches the
preferred language list, or "".

lookupBestLang.description:
Returns the language among those available that
best matches the preferred language list, using the Lookup
algorithm of BCP 47.
If none of the available languages meets the user's preferences,
then "" is returned.
Extended language ranges are not supported.
lookupBestLang.param:
{String[] | String} preferredLanguages The list of preferred
languages in descending preference order, represented as BCP 47
language tags. A string array or a comma-separated list.

params.name: preferredLanguages
params.description:
The list of preferred
languages in descending preference order, represented as BCP 47
language tags. A string array or a comma-separated list.

params.name: availableLanguages
params.description:
The list of languages
that the application supports, represented as BCP 47 language
tags.

return.description: The hash of localized resources for the module, keyed by BCP language tag

_mod.description: Private method to retrieve the language hash for a given module.

params.name: module
params.description: The name of the module

_mod.param: {String} module The name of the module

Notification event to indicate when the lang for a module has changed. There is no default behavior associated with this event,

The Intl utility provides a central location for managing sets of

Frame.name: Frame

src.description: The src of the iframe/window. Defaults to javascript:;

use.description: Array of modules to include in the scoped YUI instance at render time. Default: ['none', 'selector-css2']

container.description: The container to append the iFrame to on render.

title.description: The title to give the blank page.

defaultblock.description: The default tag to use for block level items, defaults to: p

node.description: The Node instance of the iframe.

extracss.description: A string of CSS to add to the Head of the Editor

content.description: The string to inject into the body of the new frame/window.

host.description: A reference to the Editor instance

designMode.description: Should designMode be turned on after creation.

basehref.description: The base href to use in the iframe.

id.description: Set the id of the new Node. (optional)

dir.description: The default text direction for this new frame. Default: ltr

linkedcss.description: An array of url's to external linked style sheets

render.description: Render the iframe into the container config option or open the window.
render.param: {String/HTMLElement/Node} node The node to render to

params.name: node
params.description: The node to render to

focus.description: Set the focus to the iframe
focus.param: {Function} fn Callback function to execute after focus happens

params.name: fn
params.description: Callback function to execute after focus happens

_setExtraCSS.description: Set's the extra CSS on the instance..

use.description:
This is a scoped version of the normal YUI.use method & is bound to this frame/window.
At setup, the inst.use method is mapped to this method.

_DOMPaste.description: Simple pass thru handler for the paste event so we can do content cleanup

getInstance.description: Get a reference to the internal YUI instance.

_onContentReady.description:
Called once the content is available in the frame/window and calls the final use call
on the internal instance so that the modules are loaded properly.

_instanceLoaded.description:
Called from the first YUI instance that sets up the internal instance.
This loads the content into the window/frame and attaches the contentready event.
_instanceLoaded.param: {YUI} inst The internal YUI instance bound to the frame/window

params.name: inst
params.description: The internal YUI instance bound to the frame/window

_ieSetBodyHeight.description:
Internal method to set the height of the body to the height of the document in IE.
With contenteditable being set, the document becomes unresponsive to clicks, this 
method expands the body to be the height of the document so that doesn't happen.

_onDomEvent.description:
Generic handler for all DOM events fired by the iframe or window. This handler
takes the current EventFacade and augments it to fire on the Frame host. It adds two new properties
to the EventFacade called frameX and frameY which adds the scroll and xy position of the iframe
to the original pageX and pageY of the event so external nodes can be positioned over the frame.

return.description: Hash table containing references to the new Document & Window

_create.description: Create the iframe or Window and get references to the Document & Window

_handleFocus.description: Does some tricks on focus to set the proper cursor position.

_fixIECursors.description:
It appears that having a BR tag anywhere in the source "below" a table with a percentage width (in IE 7 & 8) if there is any TEXTINPUT's outside the iframe, the cursor will rapidly flickr and the CPU would occasionally spike. This method finds all
's below the sourceIndex of the first table. Does some checks to see if they can be modified and replaces then with a so the layout will remain in tact, but the flickering will no longer happen.

_getHTML.description: Get the content from the iframe

_setHTML.param: {String} html The raw HTML to set the body of the iframe to.

params.name: href

getDocType.description:
Parses document.doctype and generates a DocType to match the parent page, if supported.
For IE8, it grabs document.all[0].nodeValue and uses that. For IE < 8, it falls back to Frame.DOC_TYPE.

DOC_TYPE.description: The DOCTYPE to prepend to the new document when created. Should match the one on the page being served.

META.description: The meta-tag for Content-Type to add to the dynamic document

Frame.description:
Creates a wrapper around an iframe. It loads the content either from a local
file or from script and creates a local YUI instance bound to that new window and document.

CacheOffline.name: CacheOffline

constructors.description: Extends Cache utility with offline functionality.

sandbox.description:
A string that must be passed in via the constructor.
This identifier is used to sandbox one cache instance's entries
from another. Calling the cache instance's flush and length methods
or get("entries") will apply to only these sandboxed entries.

expires.description:
Absolute Date when data expires or
relative number of milliseconds. Zero disables expiration.

return.description:
Cached object with the properties request, response,
and expires, or null.

retrieve.description:
Retrieves cached object for given request, if available.
Returns null if there is no cache match.

params.name: request
params.description: Request object.

params.name: e
params.description: Event Facade object.

params.name: request
params.description: Request value must be a String or JSON.

params.name: response
params.description: Response value must be a String or JSON.

add.description:
Adds a new entry to the cache of the format
{request:request, response:response, cached:cached, expires: expires}.
add.param: request {Object} Request value must be a String or JSON.

_defAddFn.param:
e {Event.Facade} Event Facade with the following properties:
<dl>
<dt>entry (Object)</dt> <dd>The cached entry.</dd>
</dl>

params.name: e
params.description:
Event Facade with the following properties:
<dl>
<dt>entry (Object)</dt> <dd>The cached entry.</dd>
</dl>

flushAll.description:
Removes all items from all sandboxes. Useful if localStorage has
exceeded quota. Only supported on browsers that implement HTML 5
localStorage.

StyleSheet.name: StyleSheet

params.name: seed
params.description:
a style or link node, its id, or a
name or guid of a StyleSheet, or a string of css text

params.name: name
params.description:
(optional) name to register instance for future static
access

constructors.description:
Create an instance of StyleSheet to encapsulate a css stylesheet. The constructor can be called using function or constructor syntax. 
var sheet = Y.StyleSheet(..);
or 
var sheet = new Y.StyleSheet(..);
The first parameter passed can be any of the following things:
  • The desired string name to register a new empty sheet
  • The string name of an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The unique guid generated for an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The id of an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The node reference for an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The Y.Node instance wrapping an existing <link> or <style> node
  • A chunk of css text to create a new stylesheet from

If a string is passed, StyleSheet will first look in its static name registry for an existing sheet, then in the DOM for an element with that id. If neither are found and the string contains the { character, it will be used as a the initial cssText for a new StyleSheet. Otherwise, a new empty StyleSheet is created, assigned the string value as a name, and registered statically by that name.

The optional second parameter is a string name to register the sheet as. This param is largely useful when providing a node id/ref or chunk of css text to create a populated instance.

toCssText.description:
Converts an object literal of style properties and values into a string of css text. This can then be assigned to el.style.cssText.

The optional second parameter is a cssText string representing the starting state of the style prior to alterations. This is most often extracted from the eventual target's current el.style.cssText.
toCssText.param: css {Object} object literal of style properties and values

params.name: css
params.description: object literal of style properties and values

params.name: cssText
params.description: (optional) starting cssText value

enable.description: Enable all the rules in the sheet

getCssText.description:
Get the current cssText for a rule or the entire sheet.  If the
selector param is supplied, only the cssText for that rule will be
returned, if found.  If the selector string targets multiple
selectors separated by commas, the cssText of the first rule only
will be returned.  If no selector string, the stylesheet's full
cssText will be returned.

params.name: sel
params.description: Selector string

isEnabled.description: Returns false if the StyleSheet is disabled.  Otherwise true.

return.description:
false if no name or sheet is not a StyleSheet
instance. true otherwise.

register.description: Registers a StyleSheet instance in the static registry by the given name
register.param: name {String} the name to assign the StyleSheet in the registry

params.name: name
params.description: the name to assign the StyleSheet in the registry

params.name: sheet
params.description: The StyleSheet instance

disable.description:
Disable all the rules in the sheet.  Rules may be changed while the
StyleSheet is disabled.

set.description:
Set style properties for a provided selector string. If the selector includes commas, it will be split into individual selectors and applied accordingly. If the selector string does not have a corresponding rule in the sheet, it will be added.

The object properties in the second parameter must be the JavaScript names of style properties. E.g. fontSize rather than font-size.

The float style property will be set by any of "float", "styleFloat", or "cssFloat".
set.param: sel {String} the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: css
params.description: Object literal of style properties and new values

getId.description: Get the unique stamp for this StyleSheet instance

isValidSelector.description:
Determines if a selector string is safe to use. Used internally in set to prevent IE from locking up when attempting to add a rule for a "bad selector".

Bad selectors are considered to be any string containing unescaped `~!@$%^&()+=|{}[];'"?< or space. Also forbidden are . or # followed by anything other than an alphanumeric. Additionally -abc or .-abc or #_abc or '# ' all fail. There are likely more failure cases, so please file a bug if you encounter one.

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string

unset.description:
Unset style properties for a provided selector string, removing their effect from the style cascade.

If the selector includes commas, it will be split into individual selectors and applied accordingly. If there are no properties remaining in the rule after unsetting, the rule is removed.

The style property or properties in the second parameter must be the JavaScript style property names. E.g. fontSize rather than font-size.

The float style property will be unset by any of "float", "styleFloat", or "cssFloat".
unset.param: sel {String} the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: css
params.description: style property name or Array of names

StyleSheet.description:
Create an instance of StyleSheet to encapsulate a css stylesheet. The constructor can be called using function or constructor syntax. 
var sheet = Y.StyleSheet(..);
or 
var sheet = new Y.StyleSheet(..);
The first parameter passed can be any of the following things:
  • The desired string name to register a new empty sheet
  • The string name of an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The unique guid generated for an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The id of an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The node reference for an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The Y.Node instance wrapping an existing <link> or <style> node
  • A chunk of css text to create a new stylesheet from

If a string is passed, StyleSheet will first look in its static name registry for an existing sheet, then in the DOM for an element with that id. If neither are found and the string contains the { character, it will be used as a the initial cssText for a new StyleSheet. Otherwise, a new empty StyleSheet is created, assigned the string value as a name, and registered statically by that name.

The optional second parameter is a string name to register the sheet as. This param is largely useful when providing a node id/ref or chunk of css text to create a populated instance.

_uiSetVisible.description:
The original Widget _uiSetVisible implementation. This currently needs to be replicated,
so it can be invoked before or after the animation starts or stops, since the original
methods is not available to the AOP implementation.
_uiSetVisible.param: {boolean} val true, if making the widget visible. false, if hiding it.

params.name: val
params.description: true, if making the widget visible. false, if hiding it.

_uiAnimSetVisible.description:
The injected method used to override the host widget's _uiSetVisible implementation with an animated version of the same.

This method replaces the default _uiSetVisible handler Widget provides, by injecting itself before _uiSetVisible, and preventing the default behavior.
_uiAnimSetVisible.param: {boolean} val true, if making the widget visible. false, if hiding it.

params.name: val
params.description: true, if making the widget visible. false, if hiding it.

_bindAnimHide.description: Binds a listener to invoke the original visibility handling when the animHide animation is complete

initializer.param: {Object} config The user configuration for the plugin

params.name: config
params.description: The user configuration for the plugin

initializer.description:
The initializer lifecycle implementation. Modifies the host widget's 
visibililty implementation to add animation.

destructor.description:
The initializer destructor implementation. Responsible for destroying the configured
animation instances.

_bindAnimShow.description: Binds a listener to invoke the original visibility handling when the animShow animation is started

by the plugin class.

Pre-Packaged Animation implementations, which can be used for animShow and animHide attribute 
values.

AutoCompleteList.name: AutoCompleteList

activeItem.description:
Item that's currently active, if any. When the user presses enter,
this is the item that will be selected.

activateFirstItem.description: If true, the first item in the list will be activated by default when the list is initially displayed and when results change.

listNode.description: Node that will contain result items.

scrollIntoView.description: If true, the viewport will be scrolled to ensure that the active list item is visible when necessary.

alwaysShowList.description: If true, the list will remain visible even when there are no results to display.

tabSelect.description: If true, pressing the tab key while the list is visible will select the active item, if any.

hoveredItem.description: Item currently being hovered over by the mouse, if any.

strings.description: Translatable strings used by the AutoCompleteList widget.

circular.description: If true, keyboard navigation will wrap around to the opposite end of the list when navigating past the first or last item.

set to an existing node, that node will be used.

stylesChange.name: stylesChange
stylesChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'styles' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

_setStyles.description: Method used by `styles` setter. Overrides base implementation.
_setStyles.param: {Object} newStyles Hash of properties to update.

params.name: newStyles
params.description: Hash of properties to update.

_getDefaultStyles.description:
Gets the default value for the `styles` attribute. Overrides
base implementation.

styles.description:
Style properties used for drawing markers. This attribute is inherited from `Renderer`. Below are the default values:
fill
A hash containing the following values:
color
Color of the fill. The default value is determined by the order of the series on the graph. The color will be retrieved from the below array:
`["#6084d0", "#eeb647", "#6c6b5f", "#d6484f", "#ce9ed1", "#ff9f3b", "#93b7ff", "#e0ddd0", "#94ecba", "#309687"]`
alpha
Number from 0 to 1 indicating the opacity of the marker fill. The default value is 1.
border
A hash containing the following values:
color
Color of the border. The default value is determined by the order of the series on the graph. The color will be retrieved from the below array:
`["#205096", "#b38206", "#000000", "#94001e", "#9d6fa0", "#e55b00", "#5e85c9", "#adab9e", "#6ac291", "#006457"]`
alpha
Number from 0 to 1 indicating the opacity of the marker border. The default value is 1.
weight
Number indicating the width of the border. The default value is 1.
width
indicates the width of the marker. The default value is 10.
height
indicates the height of the marker The default value is 10.
over
hash containing styles for markers when highlighted by a `mouseover` event. The default values for each style is null. When an over style is not set, the non-over value will be used. For example, the default value for `marker.over.fill.color` is equivalent to `marker.fill.color`.

type.description: Read-only attribute indicating the type of series.

WidgetParent.name: WidgetParent

params.name: config
params.description: User configuration object.

constructors.description:
Widget extension providing functionality enabling a Widget to be a parent of another Widget.

In addition to the set of attributes supported by WidgetParent, the constructor configuration object can also contain a children which can be used to add child widgets to the parent during construction. The children property is an array of either child widget instances or child widget configuration objects, and is sugar for the add method. See the add for details on the structure of the child widget configuration object.

_childrenContainer.description:
By default WidgetParent will render it's children to the parent's content box.

If the children need to be rendered somewhere else, the _childrenContainer property can be set to the Node which the children should be rendered to. This property should be set before the _renderChildren method is invoked, ideally in your renderUI method, as soon as you create the element to be rendered to.

selection.description: Returns the currently selected child Widget. If the mulitple attribte is set to true will return an Y.ArrayList instance containing the currently selected children. If no children are selected, will return null.

activeDescendant.description: Returns the Widget's currently focused descendant Widget.

multiple.description: Boolean indicating if multiple children can be selected at once. Whether or not multiple selection is enabled is always delegated to the value of the multiple attribute of the root widget in the object hierarchy.

defaultChildType.description:
String representing the default type of the children 
managed by this Widget.  Can also supply default type as a constructor
reference.

selectChild.param: {Number} i the index of the child to be selected

params.name: i
params.description: the index of the child to be selected

selectChild.description: Selects the child at the given index (zero-based).

Sets up DOM and CustomEvent listeners for the parent widget.

This method in invoked after bindUI is invoked for the Widget class using YUI's aop infrastructure.

Successfully added Widget or Array containing the 
successfully added Widget instance(s). If no children where added, will 
will return undefined.

Widget extension providing functionality enabling a Widget to be a parent of another Widget.

In addition to the set of attributes supported by WidgetParent, the constructor configuration object can also contain a children which can be used to add child widgets to the parent during construction. The children property is an array of either child widget instances or child widget configuration objects, and is sugar for the add method. See the add for details on the structure of the child widget configuration object.

A basic Overlay Widget, which can be positioned based on Page XY co-ordinates and is stackable (z-index support).

_attachTheadThNode.description: Adds the approriate width to the liner divs of the TH nodes before they are appended to DOM

_setUpParentTheadNode.description: Stores the main <thead> node provided by the host as a private property

_attachTbodyTdNode.description: Adds the appropriate width to the liner divs of the TD nodes before they are appended to DOM

_syncScrollY.description: Snaps container width for y-scrolling tables.

_syncScrollX.description:
Snaps container height for x-scrolling tables in IE. Syncs message TBODY width. 
Taken from YUI2 ScrollingDataTable.js

_syncWidths.description:
Adjusts the width of the TH and the TDs to make sure that the two are in sync
Implementation Details: 
Compares the width of the TH liner div to the the width of the TD node. The TD liner width
is not actually used because the TD often stretches past the liner if the parent DIV is very
large. Measuring the TD width is more accurate.
Instead of measuring via .get('width'), 'clientWidth' is used, as it returns a number, whereas
'width' returns a string, In IE6, 'clientWidth' is not supported, so 'offsetWidth' is used.
'offsetWidth' is not as accurate on Chrome,FF as 'clientWidth' - thus the need for the fork.

_setUpParentTbodyNode.description: Stores the main <tbody> node provided by the host as a private property

_createBodyContainer.description: Creates the body DIV that contains all the data.

_setUpParentTableNode.description: Stores the main <table> node provided by the host as a private property

_setUpParentMessageNode.description: Stores the main <tbody> message node provided by the host as a private property

and container width and height.

elements and the <td> elements.

_setUpNodes.description: Set up methods to fire after host methods execute

Taken from YUI2 ScrollingDataTable.js

renderUI.description:
Primary rendering method that takes the datatable rendered in
the host, and splits it up into two separate <divs> each containing two 
separate tables (one containing the head and one containing the body). 
This method fires after renderUI is called on datatable-base.

AsyncQueue.name: AsyncQueue

params.name: callback*
params.description: 0..n callbacks to seed the queue

constructors.description:
A specialized queue class that supports scheduling callbacks to execute sequentially, iteratively, even asynchronously.

Callbacks can be function refs or objects with the following keys. Only the fn key is required.

  • fn -- The callback function
  • context -- The execution context for the callbackFn.
  • args -- Arguments to pass to callbackFn.
  • timeout -- Millisecond delay before executing callbackFn. (Applies to each iterative execution of callback)
  • iterations -- Number of times to repeat the callback.
  • until -- Repeat the callback until this function returns true. This setting trumps iterations.
  • autoContinue -- Set to false to prevent the AsyncQueue from executing the next callback in the Queue after the callback completes.
  • id -- Name that can be used to get, promote, get the indexOf, or delete this callback.

complete.description: Event fired after the last queued callback is executed.

_defRemoveFn.description:
Default functionality for the "remove" event. Removes the callback from the queue.

The event object will contain a property "callback", which holds the id of a callback or the callback object itself.

params.name: e
params.description: the custom event

pause.description:
Pause the execution of the queue after the execution of the current
callback completes.  If called from code outside of a queued callback,
clears the timeout for the pending callback. Paused queue can be
restarted with q.run()

run.description:
Sets the queue in motion.  All queued callbacks will be executed in
order unless pause() or stop() is called or if one of the callbacks is
configured with autoContinue: false.

return.description: whether the run loop should continue

_schedule.description: Schedules the execution of asynchronous callbacks.
_schedule.param: callback {Object} the callback object to execute

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object to execute

_defShiftFn.description: Default functionality for the "shift" event. Shifts the callback stored in the event object's callback property from the queue if it is the first item.

params.name: e
params.description: The event object

return.description: whether the run loop should continue

_execute.description:
Handles the execution of callbacks. Returns a boolean indicating
whether it is appropriate to continue running.
_execute.param: callback {Object} the callback object to execute

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object to execute

stop.description:
Stop and clear the queue after the current execution of the
current callback completes.

_init.description: Initializes the AsyncQueue instance properties and events.

remove.description:
Removes the callback from the queue.  If the queue is active, the
removal is scheduled to occur after the current callback has completed.
remove.param: callback {String|Object} the callback object or a callback's id

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object or a callback's id

next.description:
Returns the next callback needing execution.  If a callback is
configured to repeat via iterations or until, it will be returned until
the completion criteria is met.
When the queue is empty, null is returned.

return.description: index of the callback or -1 if not found

indexOf.description:
Returns the current index of a callback.  Pass in either the id or
callback function from getCallback.
indexOf.param: callback {String|Function} the callback or its specified id

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback or its specified id

add.description:
Add any number of callbacks to the end of the queue. Callbacks may be
provided as functions or objects.

params.name: callback*
params.description: 0..n callbacks

_defExecFn.description:
Default functionality for the "execute" event.  Executes the
callback function

params.name: e
params.description: the event object

getCallback.description:
Retrieve a callback by its id.  Useful to modify the configuration
while the queue is running.
getCallback.param: id {String} the id assigned to the callback

params.name: id
params.description: the id assigned to the callback

_defPromoteFn.description:
Default functionality for the "promote" event. Promotes the named callback to the head of the queue.

The event object will contain a property "callback", which holds the id of a callback or the callback object itself.

params.name: e
params.description: the custom event

return.description: a decorated function wrapper to execute the callback

_prepare.description:
Creates a wrapper function to execute the callback using the aggregated 
configuration generated by combining the static AsyncQueue.defaults, the
instance defaults, and the specified callback settings.
The wrapper function is decorated with the callback configuration as
properties for runtime modification.

params.name: callback
params.description: the raw callback

promote.description:
Promotes the named callback to the top of the queue. If a callback is
currently executing or looping (via until or iterations), the promotion
is scheduled to occur after the current callback has completed.
promote.param: callback {String|Object} the callback object or a callback's id

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object or a callback's id

_defAddFn.description: Default functionality for the "add" event. Adds the callbacks in the event facade to the queue. Callbacks successfully added to the queue are present in the event's added property in the after phase.

params.name: e
params.description: the event object

return.description:
true if queue is waiting for a 
from any initiated transactions

isRunning.description: Determines if the queue is waiting for a callback to complete execution.

size.description: Returns the number of callbacks in the queue.

_running.type:
{Boolean|Object} true for synchronous callback execution, the
return handle from Y.later for async callbacks.
Otherwise false.
_running.description: Used to indicate the queue is currently executing a callback.

defaults.description:
Static default values used to populate callback configuration properties. Preconfigured defaults include:

  • autoContinue: true
  • iterations: 1
  • timeout: 10 (10ms between callbacks)
  • until: (function to run until iterations <= 0)

AsyncQueue.description:
A specialized queue class that supports scheduling callbacks to execute sequentially, iteratively, even asynchronously.

Callbacks can be function refs or objects with the following keys. Only the fn key is required.

  • fn -- The callback function
  • context -- The execution context for the callbackFn.
  • args -- Arguments to pass to callbackFn.
  • timeout -- Millisecond delay before executing callbackFn. (Applies to each iterative execution of callback)
  • iterations -- Number of times to repeat the callback.
  • until -- Repeat the callback until this function returns true. This setting trumps iterations.
  • autoContinue -- Set to false to prevent the AsyncQueue from executing the next callback in the Queue after the callback completes.
  • id -- Name that can be used to get, promote, get the indexOf, or delete this callback.

updateMarkerState.description: Resizes and positions markers based on a mouse interaction.

params.name: type
params.description: state of the marker

params.name: i
params.description: index of the marker

styles.description:
Style properties used for drawing markers. This attribute is inherited from `MarkerSeries`. Below are the default values:
fill
A hash containing the following values:
color
Color of the fill. The default value is determined by the order of the series on the graph. The color will be retrieved from the below array:
`["#66007f", "#a86f41", "#295454", "#996ab2", "#e8cdb7", "#90bdbd","#000000","#c3b8ca", "#968373", "#678585"]`
alpha
Number from 0 to 1 indicating the opacity of the marker fill. The default value is 1.
border
A hash containing the following values:
color
Color of the border. The default value is determined by the order of the series on the graph. The color will be retrieved from the below array:
`["#205096", "#b38206", "#000000", "#94001e", "#9d6fa0", "#e55b00", "#5e85c9", "#adab9e", "#6ac291", "#006457"]`
alpha
Number from 0 to 1 indicating the opacity of the marker border. The default value is 1.
weight
Number indicating the width of the border. The default value is 1.
width
indicates the width of the marker. The default value is 12.
over
hash containing styles for markers when highlighted by a `mouseover` event. The default values for each style is null. When an over style is not set, the non-over value will be used. For example, the default value for `marker.over.fill.color` is equivalent to `marker.fill.color`.

type.description: Read-only attribute indicating the type of series.

ColumnSeries.description:
The ColumnSeries class renders columns positioned horizontally along a category or time axis. The columns'
lengths are proportional to the values they represent along a vertical axis.
and the relevant data points.

A.Node.name: A.Node

constructors.description: Augment the YUI3 Node with more util methods. Check the list of Methods available for AUI Node.

ancestors.description:
Returns the current ancestors of the node element. If a selector is specified, the ancestors are filtered to match the selector.

Example: 

A.one('#nodeId').ancestors('div');
ancestors.param: {String} selector A selector to filter the ancestor elements against.

params.name: selector
params.description: A selector to filter the ancestor elements against.

getBorderWidth.description: Return the combined width of the border for the specified sides.
getBorderWidth.param:
{string} sides Can be t, r, b, l or any combination of
those to represent the top, right, bottom, or left sides.

params.name: sides
params.description:
Can be t, r, b, l or any combination of
those to represent the top, right, bottom, or left sides.

center.description:
Centralize the current Node instance with the passed val Array, Node, String, or Region, if not specified, the body will be used.

Example: 
var node = A.one('#nodeId');
// Center the node with the #container.
node.center('#container');
center.param: {Array | Node | Region | String} val Array, Node, String, or Region to center with

params.name: val
params.description: Array, Node, String, or Region to center with

return.description: The DOM node bound to the Node instance.

getDOM.description: Retrieves the DOM node bound to a Node instance. See getDOMNode.

appendTo.description:
Insert the node instance to the end of the selector element.

Example: 
var node = A.one('#nodeId');
// using another Node instance
var body = A.one('body');
node.appendTo(body);
// using a CSS selector
node.appendTo('#container');
appendTo.param: {Node | String} selector A selector, element, HTML string, Node

params.name: selector
params.description: A selector, element, HTML string, Node

empty.description:
This method removes not only child (and other descendant) elements, but also any text within the set of matched elements. This is because, according to the DOM specification, any string of text within an element is considered a child node of that element.

Example: 
var node = A.one('#nodeId');
node.empty();

attr.description:
Get or Set the value of an attribute for the first element in the set of matched elements. If only the name is passed it works as a getter.

Example: 
var node = A.one('#nodeId');
node.attr('title', 'Setting a new title attribute');
// Alert the value of the title attribute: 'Setting a new title attribute'
alert( node.attr('title') );
attr.param: {String} name The name of the attribute

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the attribute

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the attribute to be set. Optional.

YUI~substitute.name: YUI~substitute

substitute.description:
Does variable substitution on a string. It scans through the string
looking for expressions enclosed in { } braces. If an expression
is found, it is used a key on the object.  If there is a space in
the key, the first word is used for the key and the rest is provided
to an optional function to be used to programatically determine the
value (the extra information might be used for this decision). If
the value for the key in the object, or what is returned from the
function has a string value, number value, or object value, it is
substituted for the bracket expression and it repeats.  If this
value is an object, it uses the Object's toString() if this has
been overridden, otherwise it does a shallow dump of the key/value
pairs if Y.dump is available (if dump isn't available, toString()
is used).
This method is included in the 'substitute' module.  It is not included
in the YUI module.
substitute.param: {string} s The string that will be modified.

params.name: s
params.description: The string that will be modified.

params.name: o
params.description: An object containing the replacement values.

params.name: f
params.description:
An optional function that can be used to
process each match.  It receives the key,
value, and any extra metadata included with
the key inside of the braces.

params.name: recurse

Rating.name: Rating

elements.description: NodeList of elements used on the Rating. Each element is one Star.

labelNode.description: DOM Node to display the text of the StarRating. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-rating-label-element.

defaultSelected.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.

inputName.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.

value.description: Stores the value of the current selected Rating element.

label.description: Label to be displayed with the Rating elements.

disabled.description:
Whether the Rating is disabled or not. Disabled Ratings don't allow
hover or click, just display selected stars.

hiddenInput.description:
Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input
replace the radio elements and keep the same name.

selectedIndex.description: Stores the index of the selected element.

title.description: If set, will be used when there is no DOM title on the radio elements.

size.description: Number of Rating elements to be displayed.

showTitle.description: If true will extract the value of the title attribute on the radio, and use it on the generated Rating elements.

canReset.description: If true could be reseted (i.e., have no values selected).

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties.

constructors.description:
A base class for Rating, providing:
  • A non-obstrusive star rating control
  • Could be based on a set of radio input boxes
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Rating({
boundingBox: '#rating',
defaultSelected: 3,
disabled: false,
label: 'Label'
}).render();

params.description: HTML content

A.HTML._fragHTML5Shived.description:
A global DocumentFragment already HTML5 shived, for performance
reasons. (i.e., all nodes and its HTML5 children appended to this
fragment iherits the styles on IE).

A.HTML5.description:
An object that encapsulates util methods for HTML5 shiving.

What is a "shiv"?

To the world, a shiv is a slang term for a sharp object used as a knife-like weapon. To Internet Explorer, a shiv is a script that, when executed, forces the browser to recognize HTML5 elements.

detachAll.description:
Used by the event system's unload cleanup process.  When navigating
away from the page, the event system iterates the global map of element
subscriptions and detaches everything using detachAll().  Normally,
the map is populated with custom events, so this object needs to
at least support the detachAll method to duck type its way to
cleanliness.

Do.name: Do

_inject.description: Execute the supplied method before or after the specified function. Used by before and after.

params.name: when
params.description: before or after

params.name: fn
params.description: the function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description: the object hosting the method to displace

params.name: sFn
params.description: the name of the method to displace

params.name: c
params.description: The execution context for fn

detach.description: Detach a before or after subscription.

params.name: handle
params.description: the subscription handle

after.description:
Execute the supplied method after the specified function. Wrapping function may optionally return an instance of the following classes to further alter runtime behavior:

Y.Do.Halt(message, returnValue)
Immediatly stop execution and return returnValue. No other wrapping functions will be executed.
Y.Do.AlterReturn(message, returnValue)
Return returnValue instead of the wrapped method's original return value. This can be further altered by other after phase wrappers.

The static properties Y.Do.originalRetVal and Y.Do.currentRetVal will be populated for reference.

params.name: fn
params.description: the function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description: the object hosting the method to displace

params.name: sFn
params.description: the name of the method to displace

params.name: c
params.description: The execution context for fn

params.name: arg*
params.description: 0..n additional arguments to supply to the subscriber

before.description:
Execute the supplied method before the specified function. Wrapping function may optionally return an instance of the following classes to further alter runtime behavior:

Y.Do.Halt(message, returnValue)
Immediatly stop execution and return returnValue. No other wrapping functions will be executed.
Y.Do.AlterArgs(message, newArgArray)
Replace the arguments that the original function will be called with.
Y.Do.Prevent(message)
Don't execute the wrapped function. Other before phase wrappers will be executed.

params.name: fn
params.description: the function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description: the object hosting the method to displace

params.name: sFn
params.description: the name of the method to displace

params.name: c
params.description: The execution context for fn

params.name: arg*
params.description:
0..n additional arguments to supply to the subscriber
when the event fires.

Do.currentRetVal.description:
Contains the current state of the return value, consumable by
'after' event listeners, and updated if an after subscriber
changes the return value generated by the wrapped function.

Do.originalRetVal.description:
Contains the return value from the wrapped method, accessible
by 'after' event listeners.

objs.description: Cache of objects touched by the utility

currentRetVal.description:
Contains the current state of the return value, consumable by
'after' event listeners, and updated if an after subscriber
changes the return value generated by the wrapped function.

originalRetVal.description:
Contains the return value from the wrapped method, accessible
by 'after' event listeners.

Do.description:
Allows for the insertion of methods that are executed before or after
a specified method

StackedComboSeries.name: StackedComboSeries

constructors.description:
The StackedComboSeries class renders a combination of lines, plots and area fills in a single series. Series
are stacked along the value axis to indicate each series contribution to a cumulative total. Each
series type has a corresponding boolean attribute indicating if it is rendered. By default, all three types are
rendered.

Anim.name: Anim

paused.description: Whether or not the animation is currently paused.

direction.description:
How iterations of the animation should behave. 
Possible values are "normal" and "alternate".
Normal will repeat the animation, alternate will reverse on every other pass.

from.description:
The starting values for the animated properties.
Fields may be strings, numbers, or functions.
If a function is used, the return value becomes the from value.
If no from value is specified, the DEFAULT_GETTER will be used.
Supports any unit, provided it matches the "to" (or default)
unit (e.g. `{width: '10em', color: 'rgb(0, 0 0)', borderColor: '#ccc'}`).
If using the default ('px' for length-based units), the unit may be omitted
(e.g. `{width: 100}, borderColor: 'ccc'}`, which defaults to pixels
and hex, respectively).

iterations.description: The number of times the animation should run

iterationCount.description:
The number of iterations that have occurred.
Resets when an animation ends (reaches iteration count or stop() called).

elapsedTime.description: Current time the animation has been running.

to.description:
The ending values for the animated properties.
Fields may be strings, numbers, or functions.
Supports any unit, provided it matches the "from" (or default)
unit (e.g. `{width: '50%', color: 'red', borderColor: '#ccc'}`).
If using the default ('px' for length-based units), the unit may be omitted
(e.g. `{width: 100, borderColor: 'ccc'}`, which defaults to pixels
and hex, respectively).

running.description: Whether or not the animation is currently running.

startTime.description: Date stamp for the first frame of the animation.

duration.description: The length of the animation.  Defaults to "1" (second).

easing.description:
The method that will provide values to the attribute(s) during the animation. 
Defaults to "Easing.easeNone".

reverse.description: If true, animation begins from last frame

Anim.description: A class for constructing animation instances.

constructors.description: A class for constructing animation instances.

behaviors.description: Bucket for custom getters and setters

DEFAULT_UNIT.description: The default unit to use with properties that pass the RE_DEFAULT_UNIT test.

RE_DEFAULT_UNIT.description: Regex of properties that should use the default unit.

DEFAULT_GETTER.description: The default getter to use when getting object properties.

intervalTime.description: Time in milliseconds passed to setInterval for frame processing

DEFAULT_SETTER.description: The default setter to use when setting object properties.

getBezier.description:
Get the current position of the animated element based on t.
Each point is an array of "x" and "y" values (0 = x, 1 = y)
At least 2 points are required (start and end).
First point is start. Last point is end.
Additional control points are optional.
getBezier.param: {Array} points An array containing Bezier points

params.name: points
params.description: An array containing Bezier points

params.name: t
params.description: A number between 0 and 1 which is the basis for determining current position

stop.param: {Boolean} finish If true, the animation will move to the last frame

_runFrame.description: Called per Interval to handle each animation frame.

VMLShape.name: VMLShape

visible.description: Indicates whether the shape is visible.

transformOrigin.description:
An array of x, y values which indicates the transformOrigin in which to rotate the shape. Valid values range between 0 and 1 representing a 
fraction of the shape's corresponding bounding box dimension. The default value is [0.5, 0.5].

transform.description:
A string containing, in order, transform operations applied to the shape instance. The `transform` string can contain the following values:

rotate
Rotates the shape clockwise around it transformOrigin.
translate
Specifies a 2d translation.
skew
Skews the shape around the x-axis and y-axis.
scale
Specifies a 2d scaling operation.
translateX
Translates the shape along the x-axis.
translateY
Translates the shape along the y-axis.
skewX
Skews the shape around the x-axis.
skewY
Skews the shape around the y-axis.

Applying transforms through the transform attribute will reset the transform matrix and apply a new transform. The shape class also contains corresponding methods for each transform that will apply the transform to the current matrix. The below code illustrates how you might use the `transform` attribute to instantiate a recangle with a rotation of 45 degrees.

var myRect = new Y.Rect({ type:"rect", width: 50, height: 40, transform: "rotate(45)" };

The code below would apply `translate` and `rotate` to an existing shape.

myRect.set("transform", "translate(40, 50) rotate(45)");

stroke.description:
Contains information about the stroke of the shape.
<dl>
<dt>color</dt><dd>The color of the stroke.</dd>
<dt>weight</dt><dd>Number that indicates the width of the stroke.</dd>
<dt>opacity</dt><dd>Number between 0 and 1 that indicates the opacity of the stroke. The default value is 1.</dd>
<dt>dashstyle</dt>Indicates whether to draw a dashed stroke. When set to "none", a solid stroke is drawn. When set to an array, the first index indicates the
length of the dash. The second index indicates the length of gap.
<dt>linecap</dt><dd>Specifies the linecap for the stroke. The following values can be specified:
<dl>
<dt>butt (default)</dt><dd>Specifies a butt linecap.</dd>
<dt>square</dt><dd>Specifies a sqare linecap.</dd>
<dt>round</dt><dd>Specifies a round linecap.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dt>linejoin</dt><dd>Specifies a linejoin for the stroke. The following values can be specified:
<dl>
<dt>round (default)</dt><dd>Specifies that the linejoin will be round.</dd>
<dt>bevel</dt><dd>Specifies a bevel for the linejoin.</dd>
<dt>miter limit</dt><dd>An integer specifying the miter limit of a miter linejoin. If you want to specify a linejoin of miter, you simply specify the limit as opposed to having
separate miter and miter limit values.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

y.description: Indicates the y position of shape.

x.description: Indicates the x position of shape.

fill.description:
Contains information about the fill of the shape.
color
The color of the fill.
opacity
Number between 0 and 1 that indicates the opacity of the fill. The default value is 1.
type
Type of fill.
solid
Solid single color fill. (default)
linear
Linear gradient fill.
radial
Radial gradient fill.

If a `linear` or `radial` is specified as the fill type. The following additional property is used:

stops
An array of objects containing the following properties:
color
The color of the stop.
opacity
Number between 0 and 1 that indicates the opacity of the stop. The default value is 1. Note: No effect for IE 6 - 8
offset
Number between 0 and 1 indicating where the color stop is positioned.

Linear gradients also have the following property:

rotation
Linear gradients flow left to right by default. The rotation property allows you to change the flow by rotation. (e.g. A rotation of 180 would make the gradient pain from right to left.)

Radial gradients have the following additional properties:

r
Radius of the gradient circle.
fx
Focal point x-coordinate of the gradient.
fy
Focal point y-coordinate of the gradient.

The corresponding `SVGShape` class implements the following additional properties.

cx

The x-coordinate of the center of the gradient circle. Determines where the color stop begins. The default value 0.5.

cy

The y-coordinate of the center of the gradient circle. Determines where the color stop begins. The default value 0.5.

These properties are not currently implemented in `CanvasShape` or `VMLShape`.
